tit.cmt: 用語集では「弓道場:kyudo dojo (training hall)」となっていますが、ここではタイトルなのでまずﾛｰﾏ字読みを出し、()内に意味を補足しました。
タイトルなので説明訳括弧を削除しました。
新規統一リストに合わせました。

sen.j: 弓道場（きゅうどうじょう）とは弓道、弓術を行う為の道場を言う。
sen.e: "Kyudojo" is a dojo (a training hall) to do kyudo (Japanese art of archery) and kyujutsu (same as above).
sen.cmt: "kyudojo"という用語の説明なので" "で囲みました（以下、用語の説明と思われる箇所は同様にしました）。
sen.e: "Kyudojo" is a dojo (a training hall) to do kyudo (Japanese art of archery) and kyujutsu (same as above).
sen.cmt: スペース削除しました。
sen.e: "Kyudojo" is a dojo (a training hall) to do kyudo (Japanese art of archery) and kyujutsu (same as above).

sen.j: 近的場と遠的場の2種類あり、弓矢を扱う関係上、安全に配慮した設計がなされている。
sen.e: Kyudojos come in "kintekijo" (dojo for the regular close-range shooting) and "entekijo" (dojo for the long-distance shooting) types and they are designed with safety in mind because yumiya (bow and arrow) is used there.
sen.cmt: and前後で異なることを述べているので、2文に分けても問題無いと思います(1文で訳しておきましたが、独立した2文を単にandで繋いだだけです)。近的場、遠的場の読み仮名は調査しても発見できなかったので、弓道に詳しい知人に聞いたものです。"yumiya"は、単に"bow and arrow"のみでも構いません。
sen.e: Kyudojos come in "kintekijo" (dojo for the regular close-range shooting) and "entekijo" (dojo for the long-distance shooting) types and they are designed with safety in mind because yumiya (bow and arrow) is used there.

Kyudojos come in "kintekijo" (dojo for the regular close-range shooting) and "entekijo" (dojo for the long-distance shooting) types and they are designed with safety in mind because yumiya (bow and arrow) is used there.

sen.j: 県や市、町立の公共運動施設に併設されている事が多い。
sen.e: They are often attached to public (prefectural, city-run or town-run) sports facilities.
They are often attached to public (prefectural, city-run or town-run) sports facilities.
They are often attached to public (prefectural, city-run or town-run) sports facilities.

sen.j: 設備概要
sen.e: Summary of equipment
Summary of equipment
Summary of equipment

sen.j: 射場 射手が的に向かって弓を引く場所。
sen.e: "Iba" is a spot where an ite (an archer) draws a bow toward a mato (a target).
sen.cmt: 文章の形で訳しましたが、文章でなく用語の説明形式にするにはbe動詞を省き、ｺﾛﾝ等の記号を入れて下さい。「的」は"target"のみでも良いですが、用語集の記載通りmatoも表記し、これ以降全てmatoに統一しました。
sen.e: Iba: A spot where an ite (an archer) draws a bow toward a mato (a target).
sen.cmt: :補足し、isを削除しました。"" 削除しました。不要なスペースを削除しました。
sen.e: Iba: A spot where an ite (an archer) draws a bow toward a mato (a target).

sen.j: 審判員席がある方向を脇正面、的の方向を的正面という。
sen.e: The direction of the referee's seat is called "waki shomen" and that of the mato is called "mato shomen".
sen.cmt: 「的正面」の読み方の出典は http://ecoecoman.com/kyudo/dictionary/index.html です。
sen.e: The direction of the referee's seat is called "waki shomen" and that of the mato is called "mato shomen."
sen.cmt: ピリオドの位置を訂正しました。
sen.e: The direction of the referee's seat is called "waki shomen" and that of the mato is called "mato shomen."

sen.j: また脇正面には上座があり神棚、日章旗などが置かれる。
sen.e: In the waki shomen, there is also a kamiza (a seat of honor) where a kamidana (a household Shinto altar), the Japanese flag and so on are placed.
In the waki shomen, there is also a kamiza (a seat of honor) where a kamidana (a household Shinto altar), the Japanese flag and so on are placed.
sen.cmt: 不要なスペースを削除しました。
sen.e: In the waki shomen, there is also a kamiza (a seat of honor) where a kamidana (a household Shinto altar), the Japanese flag and so on are placed.

sen.j: 射位 的面からの距離が28メートル（近的）の位置。
sen.e: "Shai" is a spot at 28 meters from the surface of the mato in case of kinteki (close-range mato).
sen.cmt: 「近的」の説明は用語集では"short distance target"ですが、ここでは5行目の「近的場」の説明と表現を統一しました。
sen.e: Shai: A spot at 28 meters from the surface of the mato in case of kinteki (close-range mato).
sen.cmt: :補足し、isを削除しました。"" 削除しました。不要なスペースを削除しました。
sen.e: Shai: A spot at 28 meters from the surface of the mato in case of kinteki (close-range mato).

sen.j: 本座 射位から数歩下がった位置。
sen.e: "Honza" is a spot a few paces away from the shai.
Honza: A spot a few paces away from the shai.
sen.cmt: :補足し、isを削除しました。"" 削除しました。
sen.e: Honza: A spot a few paces away from the shai.

sen.j: 審判席 競技などで審判、審査員が座る。
sen.e: A referee's seat is taken by a referee or a jury during a competition and so on.
Shinpanseki: A referee's seat is taken by a referee or a jury during a competition and so on.
sen.cmt: 設備の説明なので、日本語読みを補足しました。
sen.e: Shinpanseki: A referee's seat is taken by a referee or a jury during a competition and so on.

sen.j: 矢道・矢取り道
sen.e: Yamichi and Yatorimichi
Yamichi and Yatorimichi
Yamichi and Yatorimichi

sen.j: 矢道 射場と的場までの矢が通る広間。
sen.e: "Yamichi" is a large room where an arrow flies from iba to matoba (an area which houses a sand wall and the mato).
sen.cmt: 矢道の意味を調べ、「射場から的場までの」として訳しました。matobaの説明は用語集から取り、後列との統一のためdirt hillockをsand wallに変えました。
sen.e: Yamichi: A large room where an arrow flies from iba to matoba (an area which houses a sand wall and the mato).
sen.cmt: :補足し、isを削除しました。"" 削除しました。不要なスペースを削除しました。
sen.e: Yamichi: A large room where an arrow flies from iba to matoba (an area which houses a sand wall and the mato).

sen.j: 途中に落ちた矢を保護するなどのために芝が敷かれるが、砂利、土、人工芝を用いることがある。
sen.e: It is covered with turf for the purpose of guarding a fallen arrow and so on, but in some cases, gravel, dirt or artificial turf is used.
It is covered with turf for the purpose of guarding a fallen arrow and so on, but in some cases, gravel, dirt or artificial turf is used.
It is covered with turf for the purpose of guarding a fallen arrow and so on, but in some cases, gravel, dirt or artificial turf is used.

sen.j: 矢取り道 矢道の脇には矢取り道が設けられ、的場に矢を取りに行く者はここを通る。
sen.e: "Yatorimichi" (a road to take up an arrow) is provided at the side of the yamichi, and a person who goes to the matoba to take up an arrow passes it.
sen.cmt: () 内の説明は文中の説明と一部重複するので、()内を削除し、単に"Yatorimichi Road"としても良いです。
sen.e: Yatorimichi (a road to take up an arrow): A road provided at the side of the yamichi, and a person who goes to the matoba to take up an arrow passes it.
sen.cmt: :補足し、isを削除しました。A road補足しました。"" 削除しました。
sen.e: Yatorimichi (a road to take up an arrow): A road provided at the side of the yamichi, and a person who goes to the matoba to take up an arrow passes it.

sen.j: 的場
sen.e: Matoba
Matoba
Matoba

sen.j: 近的
sen.e: Kinteki
Kinteki
Kinteki

sen.j: 安土 的を侯串（こうぐし、または ごうぐし）で刺し立て、矢を受け止める為の土盛り。
sen.e: "Azuchi" is a sand wall to receive an arrow, at which the mato is set up with a kogushi (or gogushi) stick.
sen.cmt: 「土」はdirtと訳していますが、ここの「土盛り」は用語集の「安土」の項に合わせて"sand wall"としました。
sen.e: Azuchi: A sand wall to receive an arrow, at which the mato is set up with a kogushi (or gogushi) stick.
sen.cmt: :補足し、isを削除しました。"" 削除しました。
sen.e: Azuchi: A sand wall to receive an arrow, at which the mato is set up with a kogushi (or gogushi) stick.

sen.j: 安土には主に川砂又は土が使用される。
sen.e: River sand or dirt is mainly used for azuchi.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: River sand or dirt is mainly used for azuchi.
River sand or dirt is mainly used for azuchi.

sen.j: 川砂や山砂、大鋸屑を適度に混ぜ合わせ、50度〜前後の傾斜が付くように盛る(因みに、塩分を含む砂等は矢が錆びる原因となるため好まれない)。
sen.e: River sand, mountain sand and sawn wood are mixed reasonably and heaped up to give a slope of about 50 degrees (Incidentally, sand and so on containing salt is not preferred because it causes rust of the arrow).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。最後の()文は、原文通り()の中に入れました。
sen.e: River sand, mountain sand and sawn wood are mixed reasonably and heaped up to give a slope of about 50 degrees (Incidentally, sand and so on containing salt is not preferred because it causes rust of the arrow).
sen.cmt: 不要なスペースを削除しました。
sen.e: River sand, mountain sand and sawn wood are mixed reasonably and heaped up to give a slope of about 50 degrees (Incidentally, sand and so on containing salt is not preferred because it causes rust of the arrow).

sen.j: 土が持ち込めない場所では土以外の素材が用いられる。
sen.e: Materials other than dirt are used where dirt cannot be carried in.
Materials other than dirt are used where dirt cannot be carried in.
Materials other than dirt are used where dirt cannot be carried in.

sen.j: 道場から発射される矢を受け止める。
sen.e: Azuchi receives an arrow which is shot from the dojo.
Azuchi receives an arrow which is shot from the dojo.
Azuchi receives an arrow which is shot from the dojo.

sen.j: 射られた矢が的から外れた場合、安土がクッションの役割を果たし矢が変形したりする事の無いようにする。
sen.e: It serves as a cushion to guard an arrow against deforming when a flying arrow misses a mato.
It serves as a cushion to guard an arrow against deforming when a flying arrow misses a mato.
It serves as a cushion to guard an arrow against deforming when a flying arrow misses a mato.

sen.j: 的に的中した場合も殆どの場合的を貫通し安土に刺さっている為、外れた場合と同じような役割を果たす。
sen.e: When an arrow hits the mato, azuchi also serves in the same way as noted above because most arrows which hit the mato penetrate it and stick in the azuchi.
When an arrow hits the mato, azuchi also serves in the same way as noted above because most arrows which hit the mato penetrate it and stick in the azuchi.
When an arrow hits the mato, azuchi also serves in the same way as noted above because most arrows which hit the mato penetrate it and stick in the azuchi.

sen.j: 看的所 安土の脇にある部屋又は小屋。
sen.e: "Kantekijo" is a room or a shed at the side of the azuchi.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Kantekijo: A room or a shed at the side of the azuchi.
sen.cmt: :補足し、isを削除しました。"" 削除しました。
sen.e: Kantekijo: A room or a shed at the side of the azuchi.

sen.j: 競技の際に看的をする者が詰めたり、的や安土を整備するための道具を収納したりする。
sen.e: It is used by a person who does kanteki (to check if an arrow hits the mato) to stay during a competition, and also used for storage of tools for maintaining the mato or the azuchi.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: It is used by a person who does kanteki (to check if an arrow hits the mato) to stay during a competition, and also used for storage of tools for maintaining the mato or the azuchi.
It is used by a person who does kanteki (to check if an arrow hits the mato) to stay during a competition, and also used for storage of tools for maintaining the mato or the azuchi.

sen.j: その他の設備
sen.e: Other equipment
Other equipment
Other equipment

sen.j: 投光器 夜間になんらかの照明器具によって矢道や的場を照らし、的や矢をわかり易くする。
sen.e: A floodlight or some kind of illuminator is used at night to light up the yamichi and the matoba to make a mato and an arrow easier to recognize.
A floodlight or some kind of illuminator: It is used at night to light up the yamichi and the matoba to make a mato and an arrow easier to recognize.
sen.cmt: :補足し、isを削除しました。It補足しました。
sen.e: A floodlight or some kind of illuminator: It is used at night to light up the yamichi and the matoba to make a mato and an arrow easier to recognize.

sen.j: 巻藁室 巻藁 (弓道)を常設した部屋。
sen.e: "Makiwara-shitsu" is a room where a makiwara (a straw butt for kyudo) is placed permanently.
Makiwara-shitsu: A room where a makiwara (a straw butt for kyudo) is placed permanently.
sen.cmt: :補足し、isを削除しました。"" 削除しました。
sen.e: Makiwara-shitsu: A room where a makiwara (a straw butt for kyudo) is placed permanently.

sen.j: 矢が巻藁をはずれると壁や窓ガラスが破損するので背後に畳を立てる。
sen.e: Tatami mats (floor coverings made of tightly woven grass and straw) are set up behind the makiwara for fear an arrow might break a wall or window glass when it misses the makiwara.
sen.cmt: behindの後のthe makiwaraは意味から補ったもので、省いても可です。
sen.e: Tatami mats (floor coverings made of tightly woven grass and straw) are set up behind the makiwara for fear an arrow might break a wall or window glass when it misses the makiwara.
Tatami mats (floor coverings made of tightly woven grass and straw) are set up behind the makiwara for fear an arrow might break a wall or window glass when it misses the makiwara.

sen.j: 安全面における設備
sen.e: Safety equipment
Safety equipment
Safety equipment

sen.j: 撃たれた矢は強大なエネルギーを持っているため、的以外の方向へ飛ぶと重大な事故につながる危険性がある。
sen.e: If a flying arrow goes in a different direction from the mato, there is a risk of causing a tragedy due to its considerable energy.
If a flying arrow goes in a different direction from the mato, there is a risk of causing a serious accident due to its considerable energy.
If a flying arrow goes in a different direction from the mato, there is a risk of causing a serious accident due to its considerable energy.

sen.j: そのために、安全に対する以下の設備が、一般に弓道場では行われている。
sen.e: Therefore, safety equipment including the following is generally installed in the kyudojo.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Therefore, safety equipment including the following is generally installed in the kyudojo.
Therefore, safety equipment including the following is generally installed in the kyudojo.

sen.j: 矢が射場外に飛び出るのを防ぐために「防矢ネット」が設置されたり、窓がある看的所には「アクリル板」や「強化ガラス」が設置されたりしている。
sen.e: "Arrow protection net" is installed to prevent an arrow from flying out of the iba, and "acrylic board" and "tempered glass" are installed for a kantekijo with window.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Arrow protection net' is installed to prevent an arrow from flying out of the iba, and 'acrylic board' and 'tempered glass' are installed for a kantekijo with window.
sen.cmt: 原文の「」に合せて"を'に訂正しました。
sen.e: Arrow protection net' is installed to prevent an arrow from flying out of the iba, and 'acrylic board' and 'tempered glass' are installed for a kantekijo with window.
